content.RichText: {\rtf1\ansi {\fonttbl\f0\fnil Monospaced;\f1\fnil Dialog;\f2\fnil Arial;} {\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;\red51\green51\blue51;} \margl1417\margr1417\margt1417\margb1417\widowctrl \li0\ri0\fi0\f2\fs24\i0\b\ul0\cf0 Mouth\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. What is the function of your teeth in the process of digestion?\par \par \par \b Oesophagus\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. Food travels through the oesophagus as a result of peristalsis. What is peristalsis?\par \par \par \b Stomach\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. The stomach wall secretes acids. What is the function of these acids?\par \par \par \b Duodenum and pancreas\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. The gall bladder releases bile, which is mixed with our food in the duodenum. What is the function of bile?\par \par \par \b Small intestine\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. The total surface of the inner wall of the small intestine is extremely large. How come?\par \par \par \b Large intestine\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. The cecum is a pouch at the beginning of the large intestine. In humans, the cecum is relatively small. What kinds of mammals have much larger cecums?\par \par \par \b Rectum and anus\b0\par \par 1. What is the approximate length/size of this organ?\par 2. Is there secretion of digestive juice? yes / no\par 3. If so, what nutrients are broken down? carbohydrates / proteins / fats\par 4. Is there absorption of nutrients? yes / no\par 5. If so, what nutrients? carbohydrates / proteins / fats / water\par 6. Your anus is, in fact, a circular muscle. If you are not defecating (shitting), is this muscle relaxed or contracted?\par \li0\ri0\fi0\f1\ul0\cf1\par }
